explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 3 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: 71mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: EHC 71 (1987)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 2 based on rat LD50 =f 104mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987) of the dermal administration test.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The vapor pressure of this substance is very low (it is 0.0000000036Pa at 25degC), and it was considered to be difficult to carry out vapor exposure. So it was out of a classification.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It was set as category 2 based on rat LC50 value 0.147mg/L/4H of an inhalation administration test (0.294mg/L/2H) (EHC 71, 1987).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since there is the description with redness and the pain which stimulate human skin (ICSC(J)1997; HSDB, 2003; SITTIG, 4th, 2002), and it was classified into R36/37/38 (eyes, respiratory systems and skin are stimulated) according to EU-Annex I (Accessed in Sept.2006), it was thought that there was skin irritation and it was set as category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: From the description with redness, pain and stimulate the human eye (ICSC(J), 1997; HSDB, 2003; SITTIG, 4th, 2002), and it is classified into R36/37/38( eye, respiratory organ, and skin are stimulated) according to Annex I (Accessed in Sept. 2006), it thought that there was eye irritation. And it was set as Category 2A-2B. In addition, detailed categorization is difficult.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is no this substance data. But when based on the knowledge of pentachlorophenol (CAS No.87-86-5) (EHC 71, 1987), with an inadequate test, there was dominant fatality test negativity, no significant difference though the effect occurs by the mouse spot test, and Ames test negativity. So it is classified as the out of the Category, about this substance, sodium solt.

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was classified into carcinogenic category 3; R40 (evidence is restricted although carcinogenic concerns is caused to humans) in EU-Annex I (Accessed in Sept.2006). So it was set as 2.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since embryo absorption, fetal death and teratogenicity were observed at the dose indicating maternal toxicity in tests of oral mixed feed administration to 8-19 days pregnant female rats (EHC 71, 1987), it was set as Category 2. In addition, embryo and fetus toxicity is observed but not teratogenicity of pentachlorophenol (CAS: No.87-86-5) (EHC 71, 1987; HSG 19, 1989), although teratogenicity was seen in this study.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 2 (lung, cardiovascular system, central nervous system, liver, kidneys)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (lung, cardiovascular system, central nervous system, liver, kidneys)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is description that it affects human lungs, a cardiovascular system, a central nervous system, liver, and the kidney in ICSC (J)(1997), SITTIG (4th, 2002) of Priority 2 document, and it was considered as Category 2 (lungs, a cardiovascular system, a central nervous system, liver, kidney). In addition, there is description of influence on these internal organs as knowledge of pentachlorophenol (CAS No.87-86-5) in EHC 71 (1987).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (skin, central nervous system, liver, kidneys); Category 2 (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (skin, central nervous system, liver, kidneys) through prolonged or repeated exposure; May cause damage to organs (central nervous system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since there is the statement of influence into the human skin (chloracne), liver, and kidney (EHC 71 (1987) of Priority 1 document), it was classified into Category 1 (skin, liver, kidney). Since it is supposed that it has also effect on a central nervous systems besides these organs (ICSC (J) (1997) of Priority 2 document), it was classified into Category 2 (central nervous systems).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.01mg/L of fishes (Carp) (EHC71, 1987).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=2.05 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
